channel.title: Physics
channel.description:
A yard engine shunts a freight car along a level siding. If the car stops in 50.0 seconds, 250m from the point where it was released by the engine, calculate the initial velocity of the car when it was released.
If someone could walk me through how to solve this problem, that would be really helpful.

item.title: Physics
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:4, topic:465636”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=571426.msg4137283#msg4137283 date=1351812328]
Thanks alot. I’ll be referencing that for the rest of this packet. Could anyone check this next problem to make sure I’m doing them right?
[size=15pt]
An object has an initial forward velocity of 25 m/s and a constant acceleration of -1.5m/s^2. How far does it travel in 5 seconds?[/size]

Vo = 25
a = -1.25
t = 5
X-Xo = ?

X - Xo = Vot + .5at2
X-Xo = 25(5) + -0.625(5)^2
X-Xo = 125 + -3.1275^2
X-Xo = 134.8m
[/quote]

Is the acceleration -1.25 m/s[sup]2[/sup] or -1.5 m/s[sup]2[/sup]? Your given has a different value than in the question.[/quote]

Shit… Now I’m not sure what I wrote on the paper. I had to turn it in today or I wouldn’t get any credit. =[ Oh well, thanks for your help on the first problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Physics
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Recognize it? It’s one of the 5 kinematic equations for uniform motion. This is what we are going to use to solve the problem.

Given:

∆t = 50.0s
∆d = 250m
v[sub]f[/sub] = 0 m/s

In order to fulfill the above equation, we need a final velocity (v[sub]f[/sub] or v[sub]2[/sub]), which is obviously 0 because the car stops.

RTF: v[sub]i[/sub] = ?

Sol[sup]n[/sup]: Now that some variables have been established, we need to rearrange the equation to solve for v[sub]i[/sub]:

∆d = ((v[sub]i[/sub]+ v[sub]f[/sub]) / 2) * ∆t

Since v[sub]f[/sub] is 0, simply ignore it and keep rearranging.

∆d = (v[sub]i[/sub] / 2) * ∆t
2∆d = v[sub]i[/sub] * ∆t
(2∆d) / ∆t = v[sub]i[/sub]

Therefore,

v[sub]i[/sub] = (2*∆d) / ∆t
= (2 * 250m) / 50.0s
= 10 m/s

The car’s initial velocity is 10 m/s.

Read full topic
